video.title: Full Stack Development with Java Spring Boot, React, and MongoDB – Full Course
video.description:
In this full stack development course, you will learn how to create an application using MongoDb for the database, Java and Spring Boot for the backend, and React for the frontend.

You will learn to develop a movie review application that will feature a separation of concerns between the client code and the server code. By implementing this loosely coupled architecture, these two parts (implemented using different technologies) can evolve in parallel and independently from one another. 

✏️ Farhan Hasin Chowdhury teaches the backend section.
✏️ Gavin Lon teaches the frontend section. @GavinLon 

💻 Backend Code: https://github.com/fhsinchy/movieist
💻 Frontend Code: https://github.com/GavinLonDigital/movie-gold-v1

🔗 Spring Initializr - https://start.spring.io/
🔗 JDK Download Page: https://www.oracle.com/java/technologies/downloads/
🔗 IntelliJ IDEA Download Page: https://www.jetbrains.com/idea/download/
🔗 Postman Download Page: https://www.postman.com/downloads/

🏗 MongoDB provided a grant to make this course possible.

⭐️ Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Course Introduction
⌨️ (0:01:48) JDK and IntelliJ IDEA Installation
⌨️ (0:06:13) MongoDB Atlas
⌨️ (0:20:35) Project Initialization
⌨️ (0:27:03) Project Structure
⌨️ (0:29:13) Running The Project
⌨️ (0:32:41) Writing The First Endpoint
⌨️ (0:35:33) Database Configuration
⌨️ (0:38:49) Installing Additional Dependencies
⌨️ (0:44:48) Setting Up Environment Variables
⌨️ (0:47:20) Movies and Reviews Endpoints
⌨️ (1:31:46) Testing
⌨️ (1:35:42) Backend Conclusion

⌨️ (1:36:45) Frontend Introduction
⌨️ (1:38:32) Create the React Project
⌨️ (1:43:49) Applying Bootstrap to our React application
⌨️ (1:52:47) Implementing the Use State and Use Effect Hooks
⌨️ (1:58:04) Create Home and Hero Component
⌨️ (2:06:56) Style the Carousel
⌨️ (2:15:21) Create Header Component (Navigation)
⌨️ (2:21:55) Create Trailer Component with react-player
⌨️ (2:28:46) Create Movie Reviews Functionality
⌨️ (2:34:43) Add and Get Reviews with HTTP Requests
⌨️ (2:40:33) Course Wrap Up

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Nattira Maneerat
👾 Heather Wcislo
👾 Serhiy Kalinets
👾 Erdeniz Unvan
👾 Justin Hual
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 Otis Morgan

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Idan Liberman
topLevelComment.text:
One more tip for anyone at 2:08:52 who isn't seeing the posters, getting an error that "movies" in the Hero component is undefined and therefore you can't map over it -- this is because, upon the first render, the movies props are passed down the tree BEFORE the async API called has returned. So, what's being passed is an uninitilaized value, over which you cannot map(), so that's why the app crashes. 

To fix, simply initialize the movies state to an EMPTY ARRAY (don't just leave it blank like in the tutorial). 

Hope that helps!

topLevelComment.author: Idan Liberman
topLevelComment.text:
Is anybody else having trouble accessing the movies API? At 1:57:21 the instructor manages to get a movies array, but I'm getting a CORS error: " Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource."

I have configured the axiosConfig file as instructed (copy-pasted the value from the instructor's Github). Not working. 
Something is missing with the CORS configuration. Can someone please help?

replies.author: Idan Liberman
replies.text: @Mike Lovelock Thanks man for the comment. I tried following your intructions, but still no-go. Getting the same error result. Could you perhaps show exactly what you did (like on github or in a google doc even)?

replies.author: Mike Lovelock
replies.text:
Had the same problem, but it seemed to be that the axios service was not active. My, for now at least, workaround allows me to continue, but who knows if it's enough for the rest of the tutorial. 

Anyway,  in the MoviesController class I added the @CrossOrigin annotation at class level that will allow access to all methods from anywhere.
Next in the axios config file I changed the baseURL to not use axios but directly the backend i.e. http://localhost:8080. For me at least this returned the arrays.

replies.author: djbobbydjable
replies.text: i wish he went over that part

replies.author: Idan Liberman
replies.text:
@Aliza Dixit In the meanwhile I'm using a faux api call: I'm using the movies.json file that was included in the back-end section. Just copy the file to the "public" folder of your front-end section, and in App.js, in the getMovies() function, do 
api.get("movies.json") instead of the unfortunate, broken api call. It's not a real API call but it allows you to continue with the project.

replies.author: Idan Liberman
replies.text:
@Armando Linares  In the meanwhile I'm using a faux api call: I'm using the movies.json file that was included in the back-end section. Just copy the file to the "public" folder of your front-end section, and in App.js, in the getMovies() function, do 
api.get("movies.json") instead of the unfortunate, broken api call. It's not a real API call but it allows you to continue with the project.

replies.author: School Projects
replies.text:
I was getting similar errors. I noticed that there quite a few of these type errors. For example my reviews wont map because its underfined. movies?.poster wont load but I fixed with {movies? movies[0].poster}. I am pretty sure its a front end issue not API related because my database updates correctly with the right endpoints.

I even cloned the repo and same issue. I suggest doing this code either in typscript or be more careful with types next time cuz it wasted me lots of unnecessary hours trying to fix small problems.

⌨ (0:32:41) Writing The First Endpoint
⌨ (0:35:33) Database Configuration

⌨ (1:31:46) Testing
⌨ (1:35:42) Backend Conclusion

⌨ (2:40:33) Course Wrap Up

topLevelComment.author: Afraz Hussain
topLevelComment.text: Sir when it comes to full stack website what's we develop first like first frontend or backend

replies.author: Santanu Biswas
replies.text: There is no correct way. I have done it both ways(frontent-first & backend-first). It actually depends how you are working. I feeling backend first can be better as you can design the routes and test APIs using postman or the console. Then build the frontend for the API calls. designing frontend first can increase your work because you may need to change the frontend code depending on your backend code. I would suggest plan and design the project properly before moving ahead with the coding. If you plan properly it really doesn't matter and at that point it is just personal preference.

topLevelComment.author: Akash Kaaa
topLevelComment.text: EMPTY OBJECTS OF LIST ISSUE of GET API CALL to /api/v1/movies may be due to eclipse and lombok dependency configuration. To resolve the issue find the lombok jar in ~/.m2 folder i.e.,mvn local repo and execute it with java like java -jar <path-to-that-jar>, it will open a gui and ask for your IDE path fill it, click on install and restart the IDE.
